component.name: vertx-websocket
component.title: Vert.x WebSocket
component.description: Expose WebSocket endpoints and connect to remote WebSocket servers using Vert.x
component.label: websocket

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

defaultHost.label: advanced
defaultHost.description: Default value for host name that the WebSocket should bind to

defaultPort.label: advanced
defaultPort.description: Default value for the port that the WebSocket should bind to

router.label: advanced
router.description: To provide a custom vertx router to use on the WebSocket server

vertx.label: advanced
vertx.description: To use an existing vertx instead of creating a new instance

vertxOptions.label: advanced
vertxOptions.description: To provide a custom set of vertx options for configuring vertx

useGlobalSslContextParameters.label: security
useGlobalSslContextParameters.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

CamelVertxWebsocket.connectionKey.description: Sends the message to the client with the given connection key. You can use a comma separated list of keys to send a message to multiple clients

CamelVertxWebsocket.sendToAll.label: producer
CamelVertxWebsocket.sendToAll.description: Sends the message to all clients which are currently connected. You can use the sendToAll option on the endpoint instead of using this header.

CamelVertxWebsocket.event.label: consumer
CamelVertxWebsocket.event.description: The WebSocket event that triggered the message exchange.

host.description: WebSocket hostname, such as localhost or a remote host when in client mode.

allowedOriginPattern.label: consumer
allowedOriginPattern.description: Regex pattern to match the origin header sent by WebSocket clients

consumeAsClient.label: consumer
consumeAsClient.description: When set to true, the consumer acts as a WebSocket client, creating exchanges on each received WebSocket event.

fireWebSocketConnectionEvents.label: consumer
fireWebSocketConnectionEvents.description: Whether the server consumer will create a message exchange when a new WebSocket peer connects or disconnects

maxReconnectAttempts.label: consumer
maxReconnectAttempts.description: When consumeAsClient is set to true this sets the maximum number of allowed reconnection attempts to a previously closed WebSocket. A value of 0 (the default) will attempt to reconnect indefinitely.

reconnectInitialDelay.label: consumer
reconnectInitialDelay.description: When consumeAsClient is set to true this sets the initial delay in milliseconds before attempting to reconnect to a previously closed WebSocket.

reconnectInterval.label: consumer
reconnectInterval.description: When consumeAsClient is set to true this sets the interval in milliseconds at which reconnecting to a previously closed WebSocket occurs.

router.label: consumer
router.description: To use an existing vertx router for the HTTP server

serverOptions.label: consumer
serverOptions.description: Sets customized options for configuring the HTTP server hosting the WebSocket for the consumer

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

clientOptions.label: producer
clientOptions.description: Sets customized options for configuring the WebSocket client used in the producer

clientSubProtocols.label: producer
clientSubProtocols.description: Comma separated list of WebSocket subprotocols that the client should use for the Sec-WebSocket-Protocol header

sendToAll.label: producer
sendToAll.description: To send to all websocket subscribers. Can be used to configure at the endpoint level, instead of providing the VertxWebsocketConstants.SEND_TO_ALL header on the message. Note that when using this option, the host name specified for the vertx-websocket producer URI must match one used for an existing vertx-websocket consumer.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
